ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course helped me increase my music theory analysis.  By connecting the theories to the history and situations in the given period, the professor really helped to strengthen my confidence and understanding of music, even though my music theory background was shaky coming in.  I cannot recommend this class enough, even if you're not a music major.

I learned how to analyzeusing various systems, methods, notationsa variety of Western styles of music that were prominent from 1800 onwards. I learned how to dive into any piece of music I might encounter from this time period in a specific and analytical way that will continue to grow in complexity as my musical ear develops.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Honestly I can't think of a single way this course could be improved.  It was such a joy to take.  Strengths included the professor's engaging teaching strategies, where he'd consistently help guide us through the beginning parts of our analysis and even would bring in physical props.  This class has convinced me to take more music theory classes in the future.

Strengths: The breadth was absolutely fascinating, and this meant the class was paced quickly, which I liked.

Weaknesses: Sections often felt unnecessary, or were about a topic we had moved on from already.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely.  This course helped me build my base knowledge without ever making me feel incompetent or unintelligent.  The professor was open to meeting outside of class for additional help, but even for someone with very little formal music theory background, it was taught so well that this was hardly ever neessary.

I would absolutely recommend this course to another student, without hesitation, as long as they already have a relatively strong background in music and music theory. Given that, this course opens up boundless new worlds for the curious artist.
